technique_name: 望月平衡 Wàng Yuè Píng Héng (Gazing at the Moon Balance)
deduction_content: 躯干高于水平45°或超过45° - Torso held 45° or more above horizontal level
未向支撑腿倾斜度有限 - Waist not twisted toward the rear in the direction of the supporting leg
屈软腿倾斜度不明显 - Instep of the raised bent leg not extended flat

questions.question: What is the error code for Wàng Yuè Píng Héng (Gazing at the Moon Balance)?
What are the three main deduction points for Wàng Yuè Píng Héng?
questions.answer: Deductions are applied when: 1) Torso is held 45° or more above horizontal level, 2) Waist is not twisted toward the rear in the direction of the supporting leg, an 3) Instep of the raised bent leg is not extended flat.

questions.question: What is the correct torso position for Wàng Yuè Píng Héng?
questions.answer: The torso should be held below 45° from the horizontal level.

questions.question: How should the waist be positioned in a correct Wàng Yuè Píng Héng balance technique?
questions.answer: The waist should be twisted toward the rear in the direction of the supporting leg.

questions.question: What is the correct position for the raised leg in Wàng Yuè Píng Héng?
questions.answer: The instep of the raised bent leg should be extended flat with a clear inclination.
